ca.ualberta.cmput301.t03.datamanager

Class CachedDataManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.cmput301.t03.datamanager.JsonDataManager
      • ca.ualberta.cmput301.t03.datamanager.CachedDataManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataManager

    public class CachedDataManager
extends JsonDataManager
    A JsonDataManager that wraps around an inner JsonDataManager to keep a copy of the data in a local cache using an LocalDataManager. Allows to perform some operations when the inner manager's DataManager.isOperational() returns false. Allows to perform the DataManager.keyExists(DataKey) and DataManager.getData(DataKey, Type) operations when the innerManager's DataManager.isOperational() returns false. In that case, these operations will be performed on the local cache. Created by rishi on 15-10-31.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CachedDataManager

        public CachedDataManager(JsonDataManager innerManager,
                 android.content.Context context,
                 boolean useExplicitExposeAnnotation)
        Creates an instance of the CachedDataManager.
        Parameters:
        innerManager - The inner JsonDataManager manager to be used.
        context - The Context to be used for accessing the local filesystem for caching.
        useExplicitExposeAnnotation - True, if the @expose annotations are to be explicitly used, else false. If this is set to true, only the fields with the annotation @expose will be serialized/de-serialized.

      • CachedDataManager

        public CachedDataManager(JsonDataManager innerManager,
                 android.content.Context context)
        Creates an instance of the CachedDataManager. The manager will set the "useExplicitExposeAnnotation" value to false.
        Parameters:
        innerManager - The inner JsonDataManager manager to be used.
        context - The Context to be used for accessing the local filesystem for caching.

    • Method Detail

      • keyExists

        public boolean keyExists(DataKey key)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        If the inner manager is operational, then checks if the DataKey exists in the inner manager. Else, checks the cache.
        Parameters:
        key - The DataKey to be looked up.
        Returns:
        True, if the key is found, else false.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if the communications fails with the storage media being used.

      • getData

        public <T> T getData(DataKey key,
            java.lang.reflect.Type typeOfT)
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 DataKeyNotFoundException,
                 java.lang.ClassCastException
        If the inner manager is operational, then calls DataManager.getData(DataKey, Type) on it, else calls it on the cache.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the object being retrieved. This type should match with the parameter "typeOfT", else a ClassCastException might be thrown.
        Parameters:
        key - The DataKey to be used for lookup.
        typeOfT - The Type of the object being retrieved.
        Returns:
        The retrieved object.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if the communication to the storage media fails.
        DataKeyNotFoundException
        java.lang.ClassCastException

      • writeData

        public <T> void writeData(DataKey key,
                 T obj,
                 java.lang.reflect.Type typeOfT)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the object to the inner manager, if it is operational.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the object.
        Parameters:
        key - The DataKey for the object.
        obj - The object to be stored.
        typeOfT - The Type of the object.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if the communication to the storage media fails.

      • deleteIfExists

        public boolean deleteIfExists(DataKey key)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Deletes the object from the inner manager and the cache, if the inner manager is operational. Only deletes if the key is found.
        Parameters:
        key - The DataKey for which the object has to be deleted.
        Returns:
        True, if the key is found and deleted. False, if the key is not found.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if the communication to the storage media fails.

      • isOperational

        public boolean isOperational()
        True, if the inner manager is operational, else false. In this case, isOperational == false implies that only the write and delete operations are always completely non-operational. The get and keyExists operations may still operate (partially) on the cache.
        Returns:
        True, if the inner manager is operational, else false.
